Reviews.Content: Absolutely Amazing Hotel We stayed in this hotel for Christmas 2008. The room was so nice and cosy and after a long tiring day in Tokyo it didn't feel like the standard hotel room. We stayed on the 12th floor and the view was just FANTASTIC. The bed was big and the bathroom was a good size. The restaurants within the hotel are nothing special but there are many restaurants and coffee shops around that area. The location of the hotel is just perfect. It is next to Shinagawa station - 5 min walk - which is one of the main stations in Tokyo. Also it is very convinient for excursions outside Tokyo. I highly reccomend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: andrea-stav

Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, nice rooms A great hotel. Nice clean rooms. Nice size rooms for tokyo. Close to the sinagawa train station. Friendly staff.
Reviews.Author: kailio

Reviews.Content: Loved the Grand Prince Hotel New Takanawa We were worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews but we LOVED it! We must have gotten one of the brand new remodeled rooms because it was beautiful, had a nice little balcony overlooking the garden, gorgeous big bathroom and our room was very large by Japan standards with a desk, big flat screen tv, frig, comfortable and immaculate. The beds and bedding were spotless and sooo comfortable. (our stay at a hotel in Kyoto paled by comparison and was a big disappointment for the same price.) The bus from the airport dropped us off at the lobby almost first . The lobby is very large and grand!! Beautiful. We were greeted warmly and the people were so helpful and kind. I cannot say enough good about our stay. The location is wonderful for getting around with restaurants and shops all very close-by and in the hotel itself. Our room was quiet and they brought us in a DVD player at no charge. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on their dining. But the hotel was wonderful and our room was a definate value at a bit less than $200 for a superior twin. Could not have asked for more.
Reviews.Author: marge333

Reviews.Content: great for budget travellers/ near the train/subway stations       the japanese garden
Reviews.Author: gastoneManila

Reviews.Content: Another Prince hotel       Cheap booze from Shinagawa station
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander

Reviews.Content: Pleasant Stay Overall the hotel is able to meet our needs and expectations, with some rooms for improvements. We had a pleasant stay.Pros(1) Free bus to/from disneyland  disneysea.(2) Easy to arrange for the Airport Limousine to/from airport to hotel.(3) Near Shinagawa Train Station.(4) Nearby restuarants, food outlets and convenience shops. Also has a convenience shops and some gift shops within the hotel.(5) Staffs are friendly and helpful.(6) Clean room.(7) Big lobby. With plenty of sittings. Gd while waiting for transport.(8) Has an money exchange counter (we didn't use it but would be convenient if there is a need).(9) Enjoyed the hotel's toiletries (the aromatic bubble bath gel and shampoo).Cons(1) Requested for late check-out but was asked to pay instead.(2) Mini fridge didn't seem to be working (not cold).(3) No spare pillows. Mattresses were quite hard and pillows were 'flat'.(5) 'Old' looks (in need for a renovation).
Reviews.Author: oliviamummy

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it was clean, the room that we had (which was an upgrade when we got there to the club floor) was excellent. The staff were all very accommodating and polite. There is free internet use in their business suite. There is also a convenience shop and small gift shop. The only downside was that you had to pay 1,000 yen to use the swimming pools, plus unfortunately, they close pools early in Japan (September). Tokyo itself is very clean, people are friendly and trains run on time!!
Reviews.Author: Sue20

Reviews.Content: "New Prince" is actually a frog" Stayed at this hotel as it was part of an All inclusive tour of Tokyo. The hotel is part of the Prince hotel chain in Tokyo.Check In was quick and very efficient. Rooms are in need of major renovations/makeovers. Carpets in hallways need to be replaced as they are worn, stained and musty smelly. Rooms are no better. 1970's decor. The carpets need to be replaced as they are worn, stained and in need of TLC. The beds are no better. The bed is very low to the ground and the matresses are paper thin. I woke up every morning with back pain :(It appears the bathrooms have been recently upgraded. As per the last review, the only rooms that have been revamped are the Club floor rooms located on the 15th and 16th floor only.This hotel offers a snack shop and botique shopping. Plenty of restaraunts to choose from, however they are very pricey. Take advantage of the shopping mall and restaraunts near by the hotel..a half block down the street. (Outback Steak House, TGIF, McDonald's and restaraunts in the shopping mall.Shingway Subway station (major connection hub) is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Hotel also participates in the Good Neighbour Disney shuttle service to Tokyo Disneyland, the bus shuttle is free :)I would only consider staying at this hotel again if the rooms have been gutted and remodeled.
Reviews.Author: matgor

Reviews.Content: New interior The rooms in this hotel were remodeled in April 2007. So rooms are quite new. If you sleep late and missed your breakfast, you can use your breakfast boucher for lunch of 2500 yen.
Reviews.Author: nobu

Reviews.Content: Good hotel with friendly staff The hotel is situated on a hill so you have to climb up for about a city block to reach it from Shinagawa station. There is a shuttle bus between the hotel and the station and Shinagawa Prince if you time your arrival well. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and took our luggage and escorted us to our room. The corridor is quite unique with metal french style gates infront of each room.The room was massive by japanese standards - even for 3 people - with a small balcony. The buffet breakfast was simple with a standard mix of japanese and western - nothing special. The bell desk was very helpful in booking our airport shuttle bus to Narita and handled everything for us.
Reviews.Author: LizaNTrevor

Reviews.Content: Great Location! My husband and I just got back from a weeks stay in Tokyo and the New Takanawa Prince Hotel. We were in Tokyo namely to visit Tokyo Disneyland and Tokyo Disney Sea. We found this location to be perfect for getting to the Disney parks AND expirence the rest of Tokyo. There is great shopping in and around this hotel and the train station is just a little bit of a walk, about 1/4-1/2 mile down a slight hill. It is close to Tokyo Station (the major hub to other districts in Tokyo and not too far from the Imperial Palace), Shibuya (a wonderful shopping district), Harajuku (another WONDERFUL shopping district), Ginza (more shopping). These are the districts outside of Disney that we visited. The train system was very very easy to navigate from the Shinagawa train station.The hotel's staff were wonderful and we did not find it hard to communicate with anyone there. The room was very nice, clean, the shower and bathtub were fantastic! We received an Japanese newspaper written in english every morning. There were a couple of television stations on the t.v. that had english speaking news programs and we loved watching the Japanese t.v. programs. There also were several American baseball games on Japanese stations that we were able to follow along with!We will definately stay at the New Takanawa Prince Hotel when we return to Tokyo!!!
Reviews.Author: kruskor

Reviews.Content: Pretty Nice This hotel is located conveniently literally 5 minutes away from Shinagawa station. It's a slight slope uphill - annoying while lugging baggage but not difficult. Pretty comfortable stay.HOTEL LOCATION:- Close to Shinagawa Station for easy travels- Close to many American (Outback Steakhouse  TGIF) and Japanese restaurants as well as shopping centers (at the Wing Takanawa located across  in Shinagawa Station)SERVICE/STAFF:- Fluent in English (for the most part)- Great guest services who are fluent in English and provided information, maps, and directions to wherever you would like to go. Even helped to make bus reservations to Lake Kawaguchi, a great place to view Mt. FujiROOM:- Standard twin rooms were spacious with 2 beds bigger than twin but which are rather low to the ground- Has a sitting area fit for anyone wishing to eat in the room- Each room has a balcony that you can open the window and walk out to- Bathrooms were spacious  clean- You have your own doorbell  gate outside your door!- Air conditioning doesn't work and the room can get stuffy- Decor is a bit too floral and looks dated but it's not as retro as it seems- Some furniture does show some wearADDITIONAL GOODIES:- If your stay is longer than 2 days and you don't mind your room being cleaned every other day, you can apply for a 1000 yen voucher that you can use on any of the shops or restaurants in the hotel. Best bet is the bakery downstairs where you can get a lot of good pastries/cakes/bread for 1000 yen. A form is in the room.- Free shuttle to and from Disneyland and Disney Sea- Free English newspaper
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Steer Clear of this Dump Old, outdated, not much english spoken, beds are awful, carpets were dirty, coffee shop is a rip-off. Only thing going for it is the location, near Shinagawa station and a few restaurants.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Reasonable base for tourist Walkable uphill from Shinagawa Station where the bullet train arrives/departs. Aiport bus stops outside which must be booked in advance for departure. Rooms are fine all have small balcony and small seating area. There is a no smoking floor. Each room has a small cool box which can be stocked (beer/wine/soft drinks/food etc)from hotel shop (not too expensive)or from outside (frowned upon). This was very useful during our stay. Although only a short walk from restuarnts/cafes and bars breakfast is either do it yourself in room or taken within the hotel which was quite expensive.Good 'guest relations team' who provided local and not so local photcopies of maps to aid our travels. With the JR line on the doorstep travel around the City was easy.Although the hotel is not in the centre of the action it provided a good base for 4 days in the city.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel and Price We stayed in this hotel primarily because we got a good deal on the price--13000 yen per day (plus 15% service) for what Orbitz claimed was a five-star hotel (it wasn't). This is primarily a business hotel and is not located in a part of Tokyo that sees a lot of tourists. The clientele appeared to be mainly Japanese businessmen, although there was a German tour group there as well. I don't think the hotel is used to Western tourists. English was barely serviceable. Our room looked like it had been decorated around 1970 and not touched after that. The bathroom did have one of those smart toilets, which was the most modern thing about the room. The air conditioner didn't work--it apparently does not turn on unless the room temperature is 73 degrees or higher. Since it was very humid for several days, it resulted in fairly uncomfortable evenings. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Shinagawa station, which is handy for catching the Shinkansen or the subway. The airport bus also stops here, which is handy for arriving from or going to Narita. I give this hotel an above average rating because of a combination of price and amenities; if this hotel were in the US or elsewhere, I would give it a neutral.
Reviews.Author: pasber

Reviews.Content: Clean, convenient, and English speaking A good choice for a stay in Tokyo--not a top luxury hotel, but very good The rooms are clean and each comes with the standard tea set and smart toilet as well as a tiny refrigerator. Every room has a small balcony--a plus when traveling with a smoker. The hotel is set in a small parklike area along with other Prince hotels--nice as a small refuge from the city. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Shinagawa station--handy, but, unfortunately, somewhat uphill on the way back from the station at the end of a long day. I never tried the hotel restaurants because there were so many interesting nearby neighborhood restaurants so can't render an opinion on the food quality. Most of the staff speak English and are very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: CarenWashington

Reviews.Content: 閮ㄥ眿銇墠銇杸銇屻亗銈娿伨銇?#x201d;   showReview(20327218, 'full');
Reviews.Author: tarepanda-a
